English:
But she wasn't convinced it was a trap by Akemi
Suedou until she learned he'd been researching
the Eaters, which was only just recently.
Chinese:
我是最近得知末堂曾進行侵食者的研究，
才確信那個是「末堂明實」的陷阱。
Korean:
―그게「스에도 아케미」의 함정이었다고 확신한 건
그가 이터의 연구를 하고 있었다는 것을 알게 된, 극히 최근이다
German:
Sie war erst überzeugt, dass es eine Falle von
Akemi Suedou war, als sie erfuhr, dass er sich
mit den Verschlingern befasst hatte.

English:
She probably went ahead with it out of respect for
Satoru Kamishiro, in order to protect him from
Kishibe's ambitions.
Chinese:
或許他是為了保護尊敬的神代悟留不受岸部野心的威脅，
才使出那種手段。
Korean:
존경하는 카미시로 사토루를, 키시베의 야심으로부터 지키기 위해
그런 수단을 취했는지도 모르지
German:
Es war wahrscheinlich ihr Respekt für Satoru
Kamishiro, der sie antrieb. Sie wollte ihn vor
Kishibes Ehrgeiz schützen.

English: Suedou... and my father...
Chinese: 末堂為了爸爸……
Korean: 스에도가, 아버지를…
German: Suedou ... und mein Vater ...

English: And the same time, "this" version of me...
Chinese: 那個時候，“我”——
Korean: 그때 "나"는―
German: Während „diese“ Version von mir ...

English:
fell prey to the Eaters, and entered EDEN through
a gap in the wall between the dimensions.
Chinese:
從遭侵食者侵蝕而出現的“次元之壁的縫隙"，
進入了EDEN網路。
Korean:
이터에게 침식되어 발생한 "차원을 가로막는 벽의 틈새"로부터,
EDEN 네트워크로 진입하고 있었다
German:
... verschlungen wurde, hat sich die andere
durch einen Riss zwischen den Dimensionen in
EDEN gezwängt.

English: But that gap was small.
Chinese: 不過，縫隙實在太小。
Korean: 하지만, 틈새가 꽤 작았거든
German: Doch es war nur ein kleiner Riss.

English:
The data mass had to be compressed to the level of
a Digimon still in training.
Chinese:
必須先將資料量縮小到
幼年期數碼寶貝的程度。
Korean:
데이터의 질량을 한차례, 유년기 디지몬 레벨까지
축소시켜야만 했다
German:
Die Datenmasse musste auf das Niveau eines
Ausbildungs-Digimons komprimiert werden.

English:
In that state, I could not engage in any serious
activities. I needed some form of host vessel.
Chinese:
在這個狀態下，沒有辦法好好的活動——
所以需要某個“依附體”。
Korean:
그 상태로는, 제대로 된 활동을 기대하기 힘들지―
무언가 "깃들 매체"가 필요했었다
German:
In diesem Zustand konnte ich nichts Ernsthaftes
unternehmen. Ich brauchte ein Gefäß.

English:
It was then that I found the body of Kyoko Kuremi,
who had lost her mental data.
Chinese:
然後我“遇到（找到）”了
失去精神資料的暮海杏子的身體。
Korean:
그때 "만난(찾은)" 것이
정신 데이터를 잃은 쿠레미 쿄코의 육체였다
German:
Da fand ich den Körper von Kyoko Kuremi,
die ihre Mentaldaten verloren hatte.

English:
I found that by replacing her mental data with
my own, I could take over her body.
Chinese:
我發現……只要代替精神資料進入，
就能隨心所欲地控制宿主的身體。
Korean:
정신 데이터의 대신으로 들어가면
숙주의 육체를 마음대로 할 수 있다는 것을… 난 눈치 채고 있었다
German:
Indem ich ihre Mentaldaten mit meinen ersetzte,
konnte ich ihren Körper übernehmen.

English:
That was how I was able to move about in the real
world.
Chinese: 如此一來，我便能在這個現實世界裡行動。
Korean: 그렇게 해서, 이 현실 세계에서의 행동이 가능해졌다는 거다
German: So konnte ich mich in der echten Welt bewegen.

English:
However, replacing someone else's mental functions
naturally comes with major risks.
Chinese:
只不過——
代替宿主進行精神活動，當然有很大的風險。
Korean:
단―
정신 활동의 대행에는, 물론 커다란 리스크가 있다
German:
Doch ein derartiger Austausch bringt natürlich
enorme Risiken mit sich.

English:
Human bodies are complex. You have to synch the
host and the memories to synch with the body.
Chinese:
人類的有機構造是很複雜的……要和身體同調，
必須和宿主的記憶進行一定程度的「同化」。
Korean:
인간의 유기적 구조는 복잡하지… 육체와 동조하기 위해서는
어느 정도 숙주의 기억과「동화」해야만 해
German:
Menschliche Körper sind kompliziert. Der Wirt
und das Gedächtnis müssen mit dem Körper
synchronisiert werden.

English:
This might have resulted in degeneration for me,
as a Digimon.
Chinese:
這表示，
身為數碼寶貝的我本身可能會發生質變。
Korean:
그건 즉, 디지몬인 나 자신이
변질될 가능성을 의미한다
German:
Als Digimon hätte das zu meiner Degeneration
führen können.

English:
Looking back on it, I think I was destined to
find this body... that of Kyoko Kuremi.
Chinese:
現在回想起來，我認為我和這個身體——
暮海杏子的相遇，是命中註定的。
Korean:
지금 와서 생각해 보면, 이 육체―
쿠레미 쿄코와의 만남은, 운명으로 정해져 있었다고 생각한다
German:
Rückblickend denke ich, dass ich für diesen Körper
bestimmt war ... den von Kyoko Kuremi.

English:
There was a perfect synch between her sense of
purpose and my duties, without any rejection.
Chinese:
因為她的使命感和我的任務，
可以在沒有矛盾和排斥的狀態下同步且同化。
Korean:
그녀의 사명감과 내 역할이, 모순도 거절도 없이 싱크로해서
동화할 수 있었거든
German:
Meine Pflichten und ihr Selbstverständnis wurden
perfekt synchronisiert. Es fand keine Abstoßung
statt.

English: I became Kyoko, and Kyoko became me.
Chinese: 我成為了杏子，杏子成為了我。
Korean: 난 쿄코가 되었고, 쿄코는 내가 되었다―
German: Ich wurde zu Kyoko und umgekehrt.

English: And what about Crusadermon?
Chinese: 那麼……劍皇獸也是？
Korean: 그렇다면… 로드나이트몬도?
German: Und was ist mit Crusadermon?

English:
Ah, Crusadermon fell to this planet as I did,
and must have synched with Rie Kishibe's body.
Chinese:
嗯，劍皇獸應該也是來到人類世界，
和岸部里繪的身體同化。
Korean:
그래, 로드나이트몬도 마찬가지로 인간 세계로 넘어 와서―
키시베 리에의 육체와 동화한 거겠지
German:
Crusadermon ist wie ich auf diesen Planeten
gefallen und muss sich mit Rie Kishibes Körper
synchronisiert haben.

English:
From your perspective there must be no difference
between Crusadermon's actions and my own.
Chinese:
從你們的角度來看，
會認為我和劍皇獸的行為本身沒有差別吧。
Korean:
너희의 입장에서 보면, 나와 로드나이트몬의
행위 자체에 차이는 없다고 생각할 수 있겠지
German:
Aus eurer Perspektive unterscheiden sich meine
Handlungen wohl kaum von Crusadermons.

English: We both ended up using another's body as a host.
Chinese: 不管怎麼說，都是在利用別人的身體啊。
Korean: 여하튼 타인의 육체를 마음대로 사용하고 있는 거니까 말이야
German: Wir beide nutzten einen anderen Körper als Gefäß.

English:
[p]...
Had your body been available,
I would have used it without hesitation.
Chinese:
[p]……
如果你的身體有用，
我應該會毫不猶豫地使用。
Korean:
[p]…
만약 네 육체가 유용했다면
난 망설임 없이 사용했겠지
German:
[p] ...
Ich hätte dich gewählt, wenn diese
Option zur Verfügung gestanden hätte.

English: Do you think less of me for that?
Chinese: 你會瞧不起我嗎？
Korean: …경멸하는가?
German: Nimmst du mir das übel?

English:
Meh. Not really.
No, I'm flattered you'd pick me!
Sounds like it'd be convenient!
Chinese:
也不至於。
我反而希望你用我！
意思是我的身體沒用嗎……！？
Korean:
…그렇지도 않슴다
오히려 바라는 바임다!
그보다, 유용하지 않다는 거군요…!?
German:
Meh. Was soll’s.
Nein, das ist doch ein Kompliment für mich!
Na, wäre doch praktisch!

English: Heh! Just the answer I'd expect from you.
Chinese: 呵呵，真像你會說的答案啊。
Korean: …후후, 너다운 대답이로군
German: Haha, genau das hätte ich von dir erwartet.

English: To think that you've been living as a human!
Chinese: 沒想到，你居然以人類的身分生活……
Korean: 설마, 인간으로서 지내고 있었다니…
German:
Allein der Gedanke, dass du wie ein Mensch gelebt
hast!

English:
Oh, yeah! Even Omnimon didn't catch on.
There's no way we could have figured it out.
Chinese:
這樣啊，奧米加獸也沒有發現啊。
那我們也不可能發現吧……
Korean:
그렇구나, 오메가몬도 눈치 채지 못했었구나
그럼 우리들이 알 리가, 없지…
German:
Ach ja! Selbst Omnimon hat es nicht gemerkt.
Da hatten wir ja keine Chance.

English: It might be selfish to ask you to trust a Digimon you know nothing about, but...
Chinese:
要你們相信我這個來路不明的數碼寶貝，
或許很自私……
Korean:
정체 모를 디지몬인 날 신용해라, 라는
뻔뻔한 얘기일지도 모르겠지만…
German:
Vielleicht ist das eine egoistische Bitte, wo ich
doch ein wildfremdes Digimon bin, aber ...

English:
I'd like to keep working together, as we have
up until now. As one of the gang.
Chinese:
但我希望你們如同往常——
讓我以伙伴的身分協助你們。
Korean:
부디, 여태까지 그랬던 것처럼―
너희들의 동료로서, 협력하게 해다오
German:
Ich würde gerne wie bisher zusammenarbeiten.
Als Teil der Gruppe.

English: Oh, knock it off, Kyoko!
Chinese: 等等，別這樣啦，杏子姊！？
Korean: 잠깐, 그러지 마요, 쿄코 씨!?
German: Lass den Quatsch, Kyoko!

English:
You've got a human body? And you're a Digimon 
inside? I have no idea what any of that means!
Chinese:
身體是人類！？內在是數碼寶貝！？
是很莫名其妙沒錯啦！
Korean:
그야, 몸은 인간이고!? 안쪽 사람은 디지몬!?
이라던가? 정말―, 전혀 의미를 모르겠고?
German:
Du hast einen menschlichen Körper? Bist aber ein
Digimon? Ich verstehe gar nichts mehr!

English:
And you'd serve up coffee that was like drinking
the River Styx with a big smile on your face the
whole time!
Chinese:
還用燦爛無比的笑容讓我們喝下
那種有如孟婆湯的有害物質（咖啡）！
Korean:
그런 선즈 리버 풍미의 독극물(커피)을
최고의 미소를 지으면서 마시게 한다던가?
German:
Und die ganze Zeit hast du diese Kloake von Kaffee
serviert und dabei gestrahlt wie ein
Honigkuchenpferd!

English:
You actually thought that tasted good! So no,
I wasn't totally convinced that you were human.
Chinese:
雖然我也曾經想過
妳簡直不是人類！？妳和妳的味覺都是未確認生物！？
Korean:
진짜 인간이 아니야!? 미각까지 UMA!? 라고는?
생각하기도 하지만―
German:
Du dachtest echt, dass der gut schmeckt! Also
hast du nicht so ganz überzeugt als Mensch!

English:
Hmm... I see. So what you're saying is that my
creations were lacking?
Chinese:
嗯……這樣啊，妳的意思是，
我過去的作品無法滿足妳嗎？
Korean:
흐음… 그런가, 지금까지의 작품으로는 부족하다고
말하고 싶은 거로군?
German:
Hmm ... verstehe. Meine Kreationen waren also
noch verbesserungswürdig?

English:
Let me redouble my efforts, then.
Give me a chance to redeem myself!
Chinese:
那麼，我承諾在那方面也會全力以赴。
給我挽回的機會吧。
Korean:
그럼, 그쪽 방면으로도 전력을 다하겠다고 약속하지
만회의 찬스를 줬으면 좋겠군
German:
Dann strenge ich mich doppelt an!
Gib mir eine Chance, es wiedergutzumachen!

English:
Yikes! You intend to kill us with coffee?!
No, that's not it!
Chinese:
噫……！？殺、殺人預告…！？
不是那個意思啦……！
Korean:
히익…!? 사, 살인 예고…!?
아니, 그게 아니라…!
German:
Um Himmels willen! Willst du uns umbringen?!
Nein, das wird nichts!

English:
Kyoko has been trying all along to do something
about EDEN Syndrome and the Eaters.
Chinese:
杏子姊一直在為我們想辦法解決
EDEN症候群和侵食者……
Korean:
쿄코 씨는, 줄곧 EDEN 증후군이나 이터를
어떻게든 하려고 해 주기도 했고…
German:
Kyoko hat schon die ganze Zeit versucht, etwas
wegen dem EDEN-Syndrom und den Verschlingern
zu unternehmen.

English: Don't none of you see that we can't not trust her?
Chinese: 事到如今還說什麼相信不相信的，真是太離譜了！
Korean: 지금 와서 신용을 한다던가 안 한다던가, 있을 수 없다는 얘기예요!
German:
Versteht ihr nicht, dass wir ihr nicht NICHT
vertrauen können?

English: Nokia, wait, is that a yes or a no?
Chinese: 諾、諾奇雅小姐……妳到底是相信，還是不相信？
Korean: 노, 노키아 씨… 결국 그거, 어느 쪽인 거예요…?
German: Moment mal, Nokia. Heißt das jetzt ja oder nein?

English:
Now I want to ask something of you, Kyoko.
The cause for the appearance of Eaters in the
Digital World lies with us.
Chinese:
我反而想問杏子姊，
數碼世界裡會出現侵食者，
是因為我們……
Korean:
…쿄코 씨에게는, 반대로 여쭙고 싶어요
디지털 월드에 이터가 출현한 원인은
저희들에게 있어요…
German:
Ich möchte dich etwas fragen, Kyoko.
Wir sind der Grund, warum in der Digitalen Welt
Verschlinger aufgetaucht sind.

English: And yet, why are you helping us?
Chinese: 但妳卻……為什麼要幫助我們呢？
Korean: 그런데도… 어째서 협력해 주시는 거죠?
German: Warum hilfst du uns dann?

English: I must bring my role to fruition. That is all.
Chinese: 我不過是在完成自己的任務。
Korean: 난, 내 역할을 다하려는 것 뿐이다
German: Ich muss meine Rolle erfüllen. Mehr nicht.

English:
As for the incident eight years ago, you were all
so young. There was nothing you could have done,
was there?
Chinese:
關於八年前的事件，你們當時年紀還小，
根本無能為力……不是嗎？
Korean:
…8년 전의 사건에 대해서는, 어린 너희들은
어떻게도 할 수 없었을 거다 …아닌가?
German:
Was den Vorfall vor acht Jahren betrifft,
da wart ihr ja alle so jung. Ihr hättet doch gar
nichts tun können, oder?

English: But... It's still all so terrible.
Chinese: 但……我心裡還是有點難受……
Korean: 하지만… 역시, 좀 힘드네…
German: Aber ... es ist trotzdem alles so schrecklich.

English:
Awful things happened to the Digital World, and
it's all our fault.
Chinese: 都是我們害得數碼世界變成這樣……
Korean:
우리들 때문에 디지털 월드가
위험해 졌다니…
German:
Mit der Digitalen Welt ist etwas Schlimmes passiert
und es ist allein unsere Schuld.

English: Would it have been better not to have remembered?
Chinese: 妳是覺得不要想起來比較好嗎？
Korean: 기억해내지 않는 편이 좋았을 거라고 생각하는가?
German:
Wäre es dir lieber, dich doch nicht daran zu
erinnern?

English: No...
Korean: 으~응…
German: Nein ...

English:
I don't think that! It's terrible, but...
I'm personally glad I remembered!
Chinese:
我沒這麼想！老實說我既難受又痛苦……
但我還是很慶幸能想起來！
Korean:
…아뇨! 솔직히 힘들고 괴롭지만…
전, 기억해내서 다행이라고 생각해요…!
German:
Das denke ich nicht! Es ist zwar schlimm ...
Aber ich bin froh, dass ich es wieder weiß!

English:
I am, too. Even if I could forget the bad things,
I wouldn't want to forget what's important.
Chinese:
我也是……就算可以忘記討厭的事……
但我不想連重要的事都忘掉。
Korean:
저도… 싫은 기억을 잊을 수 있다 해도…
소중한 것까지, 잊고 싶지는 않아요
German:
Ich auch. Selbst wenn ich das Schlimme vergessen
könnte, will ich doch das Wichtige behalten.

English: That's right!
Chinese: 沒錯……！
Korean: 그렇지…!
German: Jawohl!

English:
Agumon and Gabumon, [p], Yuuko,
Yuugo and Arata, too!
Chinese:
亞古獸、加布獸也是，[p]、小悠子也是，
然後勇吾也是，新也算啦……！
Korean:
아구몬도 파피몬도, [p]도 유콧치도
그리고 유고 군도, 겸사겸사 아라타도…!
German:
Agumon und Gabumon, [p], Yuuko,
Yuugo und auch Arata!

English:
The friends we had back then.
We can't forget them. They're precious memories!
Chinese:
那個時候認識的朋友……
是我絕不能忘記的重要回憶！
Korean:
그때 생긴 친구의 기억…
잊어서는 안 되는, 소중한 추억인걸!
German:
Unsere Freunde von damals.
Die dürfen wir nicht vergessen.
Die Erinnerungen sind kostbar!

English:
Since remembering my brother...
and also Arata as well...
Chinese:
既然想起來了，哥哥……
還有新……
Korean:
기억해 낸 이상, 오빠를…
…겸사겸사, 아라타 씨도
German:
Jetzt, wo ich das mit meinem Bruder wieder
weiß ... und auch mit Arata ...

English: We have to go to them, right?
Chinese: 我們一定要去迎接他們，是吧！
Korean: 마중하러 가야, 겠지!
German: Wir müssen zu ihnen, stimmt’s?

English:
Heh! Just the answer I'd expect from you two.
And moreover...
Chinese:
呵，很像你們會說的答案。
更重要的是——
Korean:
훗, 너희들다운 대답이군
그리고 무엇보다―
German:
Haha! Genau das erwarte ich von euch beiden.
Außerdem ...

English: It's a very human answer.
Chinese: 實在很像人類會說的答案。
Korean: 실로, 인간다운 대답이다
German: ... ist das eine sehr menschliche Antwort.
